historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=+0.0015) while current U/params match the best record, so I’ll keep U steady and make a small stabilizing tweak to counter the slight complexity decay without risking a destabilizing phase shift (noting past k_A_decay changes sometimes harmed A).

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising (dA/dt>0), but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt<0), so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) while reducing diversity decay pressure (lower k_D_decay) and slightly boosting intrinsic diversity replenishment (k_D_growth) to stabilize D without destabilizing A (history shows large k_A_decay moves can be risky).

Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but Diversity is collapsing (dD/dt=-0.0116) largely from overly strong quadratic decay (k_D_decay=0.10 vs best 0.03), so I’ll keep U at the best-record value (0.10) while reverting k_D_decay toward the best to stabilize D without sacrificing A.

Agency is already maxed but has a small negative drift while Diversity is collapsing (dD/dt=-0.009), so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and slightly reduce diversity decay (k_D_decay) plus agency decay (k_A_decay) to stabilize A without adding selection pressure (per history, k_D_decay tweaks have been safe and k_A_decay changes can swing A).

Agency is already above the 0.75 threshold and still rising (dA/dt>0) while complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record level and reduce k_A_decay (which historically produced the biggest A gains) plus slightly reduce k_C_decay to stabilize C and sustain A’s upward trajectory.

Agency is already above the 0.75 threshold and still rising (dA/dt=0.0030), so to preserve the winning configuration near the best-record U=0.10 while accelerating A further, I’ll keep U steady and reduce the unusually high k_A_decay (currently 0.100 vs best-record 0.005) to prevent unnecessary agency loss (noting past k_A_decay tweaks were high-impact, including the big drop at Gen 744.7).

A is already well above 0.75 but is fading mainly because k_A_decay is currently much higher than the best-record setting (0.02 vs 0.005) and D is starting to collapse, so I’ll revert decay toward the best while keeping U at the proven 0.10 to stabilize A without increasing selection pressure (history shows large A drops when decay tweaks overshoot, e.g., Gen 744.7).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, and since the best record occurred at U=0.10 with essentially the same parameter regime (while past aggressive k_A_decay/k_D_decay tweaks caused large drops, e.g., Gen 744.7), I’ll keep U steady and make only a tiny decay reduction to sustain A without destabilizing C/D.

A is already well above 0.75 and still rising, but D is collapsing (dD/dt=-0.007) so I’ll keep U at the proven-best 0.10 while reducing diversity loss via a small k_D_decay decrease (historically k_D_decay tweaks have improved A, e.g., Gen 687.1 and 906.0) to preserve long-run open-endedness without risking an A crash like the large drop at Gen 744.7.

A is already safely >0.75 but all derivatives are negative (C, D, A fading), so I’ll keep U at the proven-best 0.10 while stabilizing the slide by slightly reducing decay terms (avoiding big shifts given past large A drops when k_A_decay was perturbed too aggressively).

name: Low-Entropy Agency Harvester
description: This agent crossed the threshold by minimizing self-loss while aggressively converting environmental difficulty into agency: an extreme k_AU=0.99 paired with very low k_A_decay=0.003 lets agency accumulate and persist even under U=0.10. Its emergence history shows repeated tuning of decay terms—especially k_A_decay and k_D_decay—where lowering decay repeatedly restored agency after diversification/complexity adjustments briefly destabilized it, culminating in a high-agency, high-diversity, moderate-high complexity phenotype (A=0.993, D=0.966, C=0.845).
